title: Nicholas P. Sweeney
text:
Nicholas P. Sweeney is the Sir Terry Leahy Fellow of Urban and Regional Economics at Alliance Manchester Business School.
His research specialises in XXX.
He joined the University of Manchester in 2025 from the University of Cambridge, after a PhD entitled ‘Devolution and Space in England: Empirical Essays on Economic Growth, Democratic Engagement and Health’. The thesis comprised three solo-authored papers, submitted in under three years, and subsequently published in leading journals (Urban Studies, Political Geography, and Social Science & Medicine).
Nicholas also completed his undergraduate and master’s degrees at the University of Cambridge, specialising in Economic Geography. His earlier academic achievements include a master’s degree with Distinction, including a mark of 87% in Research Methods, and—at undergraduate level—the highest overall marks in his cohort and the award for Best Final-Year Dissertation.
Outside of academic work, Nicholas has focused on contributing in policy domains, holding positions at the OECD, working on the ASEAN Development Outlook Report 2020-2025 and MillNET_i.




Devolution and multi-level governance
Spatial inequalities and local economic development
Political (dis)engagement in declining places
High streets, retail diversity, and spatial consumption patterns
Mobility, access to services, and health inequalities





Causal inference in applied microeconometrics (e.g. difference-in-differences, matching, IV)
Spatial data and geospatial analysis (QGIS / GIS workflows)
Reproducible research in R and Python





See Publications for papers and working papers.
See CV for a full academic CV (PDF).
